Now it remains to be seen if audiences prefer this camaraderie to Simon Cowell 's sideway glances of disdain. shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement. that the American "X Factor" would be open to contestants as young as 12 years old. Unlike "American Idol," the competition is open to vocal groups as well as solo singers. I've never believed there should be a cut-off age for talent, and we are going to put our money where our mouths are with the$ 5 million recording contract, Simon Cowell said in a press release. House, many signs point to him running for Indiana governor in 2012 instead. No one else mulling a presidential run faces a similar quandary. Mr. Bauer Mike Pence says he plans to announce his decision early next year. I'd put money on him running for governor over president, because the field is a lot smaller and he wouldn't be running against an incumbent, says Indiana's recently retired GOP chairman, Murray Clark .
